abstracts.cdata!:
The development objectives of the
            Electricity Sector Efficiency Enhancement Project are to
            help the Borrower to assist in maintaining and increasing
            the electricity supply and the reliability and
            cost-effectiveness of electricity services; and to enhance
            the performance of key institutions of the energy sector.
            The restructuring will consist of a partial cancellation of
            the credit and a reallocation between credit categories, as
            requested by the Government of Senegal (GoS). The
            cancellation of the project subcomponent does not change the
            Project Development Objectives (PDO). A first extension of
            the credit closing date was granted from January 31, 2009 to
            December 31, 2010. To date the amount of US$ 4,646,908.21
            has been disbursed. To date rehabilitation/reinforcement
            works in generation and transmission have not started due to
            delays in: 1) the selection of investments by SENELEC
            (Societe Nationale d'Electricite - National Power
            Utility of Senegal) in view of insufficient funding and; 2)
            the preparation of bidding documents once the choice was made.
